Criterion.title: Criterion
Criterion.description: A criterion on which bids, tenderers, lots or items will be judged, evaluated or assessed.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this criterion. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](https://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

relatesToTenderer.title: Relates to tenderer
relatesToTenderer.description: The criterion judges, evaluates or assesses a tenderer.

relatedItem.title: Related item
relatedItem.description: The identifier of the item in the tender section to which this criterion applies.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this criterion applies.

requirementGroups.title: Requirement groups
requirementGroups.description: A list of requirement groups for this Criterion. A criterion is satisfied by one or more requirement groups being met. A requirement group is met when all requirements in the group are satisfied.

RequirementGroup.title: Requirement group
RequirementGroup.description: A requirement group is a set of requirements that must be fulfilled together to validate a criterion.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this requirement group. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](https://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of this requirement group.

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: A list requirements which must all be satisfied for the requirement group to be met.

Requirement.title: Requirement
Requirement.description: An atomic requirement. Requirements can specify the expected value that the response has to contain, or a range of threshold values within which the response has to fit in. The requirement may apply to a certain period of time.

id.title: Requirement identifier
id.description: The identifier for this requirement. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](https://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

title.title: Requirement title
title.description: The title of this atomic requirement.

description.title: Requirement description
description.description: A free text description for this atomic requirement.

dataType.title: Requirement datatype
dataType.description: The data type in which the response must be provided.

pattern.title: Response validation pattern
pattern.description: A regular expression with which to validate the response.

expectedValue.title: Expected value
expectedValue.description: The expected value of the requirement, when the response must be specific value.

minValue.title: Minimum value
minValue.description: The lower bound of the requirement, when the response must be within a certain range.

maxValue.title: Maximum value
maxValue.description: The upper bound of the requirement, when the response must be within a certain range.

period.title: Period
period.description: The period to which the requirement applies: for example, the tenderer's turnover in a given year.

RequirementResponse.title: Requirement response
RequirementResponse.description: An assertion that responds to a single requirement. A response provides the value for the requirement and may provide the period to which it applies.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: The unique identifier of this response in the context of the contracting process.

period.title: Period
period.description: The period to which the response applies.

requirement.title: Related requirement
requirement.description: A reference to the requirement to which the response applies.

id.title: Requirement ID
id.description: The identifier of the requirement to which the response applies.

title.title: Requirement title
title.description: The title of the requirement to which the response applies.

requirementResponses.title: Requirement responses
requirementResponses.description: The responses of this bid to the requirements.

criteria.title: Criteria
criteria.description: Criteria on which bids, tenderers, lots or items will be judged, evaluated or assessed.
